config.question: The Jeffersonians and the Federalists differed on which major issue?

choices.content: The Jeffersonians wanted to expand the U.S. Army, while the Federalists pushed for a navy department.
The Jeffersonians envisaged an urban commercial nation, while the Federalists envisaged a simple agrarian economy.
The Jeffersonians advocated creating national financial institutes to secure finances, while the Federalists wanted an unrestricted economic environment.
The Jeffersonians envisaged an agrarian economy, while the Federalists envisaged an urban commercial economy.

answer_3.response: Consider This: The two sides had opposing visions of what the national economy should look like. See L.O. 7.1 Why was George Washington unable to overcome division within the new government?
